articles.headline: ‘El Chapo’ Guzmán’s Escape in Mexico Adds to Strains With U.S.
articles.snippet: The United States has offered everything it has to help capture the notorious drug kingpin, but so far the Mexicans have kept the Americans at bay.
articles.abstract: The United States has offered everything it has to help capture the notorious drug kingpin, but so far the Mexicans have kept the Americans at bay.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — Hours after the world’s most infamous drug lord, Joaquín Guzmán Loera, escaped Mexico’s highest security prison over the weekend, the United States offered everything it has — marshals, drones, even a special task force — to help recapture him.
articles.byline: By Azam Ahmed and Damien Cave

articles.headline: I.M.F. Demands Greece Debt Relief as Condition for Bailout
articles.snippet: The International Monetary Fund said in an analysis submitted to Greece’s creditors that the country’s debt load was unsustainable.
articles.abstract: The International Monetary Fund said in an analysis submitted to Greece’s creditors that the country’s debt load was unsustainable.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — The International Monetary Fund threatened to withdraw support for Greece’s bailout on Tuesday unless European leaders agree to substantial debt relief, an immediate challenge to the region’s plan to rescue the country.

articles.headline: Sizing Up Hillary Clinton’s Plans to Help the Middle Class
articles.snippet: The presidential candidate’s economic agenda is grounded in top research, but falls short of the challenge of helping “everyday Americans” get ahead.
articles.abstract: The presidential candidate’s economic agenda is grounded in top research, but falls short of the challenge of helping “everyday Americans” get ahead.
articles.lead_paragraph: Could President Hillary Clinton restore the American middle class?

articles.headline: New York Stock Exchange System Failure Draws Attention to Staff Cuts
articles.snippet: Staff reductions in New York have been under scrutiny because of the possibility that they left the exchange without enough experienced people to manage a crisis like the one it faced last Wednesday.
articles.abstract: Staff reductions in New York have been under scrutiny because of the possibility that they left the exchange without enough experienced people to manage a crisis like the one it faced last Wednesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the New York Stock Exchange’s systems went down during the trading day last week, few longtime employees who had helped lead the exchange during past technical problems were on hand.

articles.headline: One Way to Reform Reddit: Give Users a Share in Profits
articles.snippet: It might be time for Reddit to move away from its reliance on volunteers to run its operations and give Reddit’s users a financial stake in the company’s success.
articles.abstract: It might be time for Reddit to move away from its reliance on volunteers to run its operations and give Reddit’s users a financial stake in the company’s success.
articles.lead_paragraph: Imagine you’ve just been hired as the manager of an aging local sandwich shop. Let’s call it Breaddit. Congratulations.

articles.headline: Amazon Dreams Up a Sale in a Calendar Bursting With Them
articles.snippet: Even Black Friday is getting lost in the blur of perpetual discounts as some of the biggest retailers go head-to-head Wednesday in a new midsummer event.
articles.abstract: Even Black Friday is getting lost in the blur of perpetual discounts as some of the biggest retailers go head-to-head Wednesday in a new midsummer event.
articles.lead_paragraph: Rollback. Doorbuster. Blowout prices. Do those words mean anything anymore?

articles.headline: As Jade Helm 15 Military Exercise Begins, Texans Keep Watch ‘Just in Case’
articles.snippet: Jade Helm 15, a seven-state training exercise that the Army and local officials say is no cause for alarm, has generated paranoia for months, fueled by conservative bloggers.
articles.abstract: Jade Helm 15, a seven-state training exercise that the Army and local officials say is no cause for alarm, has generated paranoia for months, fueled by conservative bloggers.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHRISTOVAL, Tex. — Despite the Internet chatter about trains with shackles and Walmart stores being closed to be used as detention camps, this small West Texas town on Wednesday seemed to be surviving the start of Jade Helm 15, the military exercise that some people fear is actually a ruse for a federal takeover of the state.

articles.headline: Greece, Its Back to the Wall, Adopts Austerity Steps
articles.snippet: Lawmakers approved a package of harsh austerity measures and economic policy changes that were required by its creditors as the terms of a $94 billion bailout package.
articles.abstract: Lawmakers approved a package of harsh austerity measures and economic policy changes that were required by its creditors as the terms of a $94 billion bailout package.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATHENS — Under threat from the nation’s creditors to move quickly or lose any chance of obtaining a desperately needed new bailout package, Greece’s Parliament approved painful new austerity measures early Thursday, virtually guaranteeing that life would get harder for millions of Greeks.
articles.byline: By Suzanne Daley and James Kanter

articles.headline: Janet Yellen Warns Congress Against Adding to Fed’s Oversight
articles.snippet: The central bank chairwoman says additional scrutiny, backed by Republicans, could cause collateral damage to the broader economy.
articles.abstract: The central bank chairwoman says additional scrutiny, backed by Republicans, could cause collateral damage to the broader economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, told lawmakers on Wednesday that proposals to increase congressional oversight of the central bank could cause collateral damage to the broader economy.
